result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven A. MORGAN was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Trespass to Dwelling, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Manitowoc County Clerk of Circuit Court

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime
PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

supervisions.notes: Under the Huber Law.  Court authorizes release for the defendant to attend his OWI assessment classes.
Defendant is ordered to write a letter of apology, with an explanation for his actions, to the victim within 30 days and deliver a copy to the district attorney.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Steven A. MORGAN

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: The status conference set for 08-13-14 at 9:30 a.m. is canceled.  Copy of apology letter is attached.

Defendant in custody.
Attorney Prost indicates this hearing was scheduled because the defendant has not completed the apology letter within the time given by the court. 
The defendant states that he completed the letter and gave it to his attorney, Philip Hoff, to distribute to the necessary people.
Attorney Prost states the victim has not received the letter.
The Court will reschedule this matter to 08-13-14 at 9:30 a.m.  
Within this time, both the defendant and the State are to contact Attorney Hoff and find out what happened to the letter and why it hasnt been distributed.
Minutes.
Status conference is set for 07-16-14 at 2:30 p.m.

Stipulation and Order to Amend Judgment of Conviction.
It is hereby ordered that Mr. Morgan be required to report to the Manitowoc County Jail to serve his jail sentence in the above referenced case on Monday, June 23, 2014 at 3:00 p.m.
Copy delivered to jail.
Cover letter.
Payment Plan requested for monthly payment of $50.00; payment plan documents filed with case.

The State files an Amended Information which adds counts 3, criminal trespass to dwelling, contrary to Section 943.13 of the Wisconsin Statutes.  
NO CONTEST plea entered to count 3, criminal trespass to dwelling.  Convicted.
The State moves to dismiss and read in counts 1 and 2, PTC burglary and PTC theft.  Motion granted.
Defendant is sentenced to the Manitowoc County Jail for five (5) months, under the Huber Law, commencing on 06-19-14 at 8:00 a.m.  Court authorizes release for defendant to attend his OWI assessment classes.
The Court orders the defendant to write a letter of apology, with an explanation for his actions, to the victim within 30 days.  Copy to be delivered to D.A.
$443.00 court costs imposed, to be paid by 07-19-14 or 9 days county jail for failure to pay.
Amended Information.
Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
Victim Impact Statement.
Minutes.
State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.

Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 3 for trial.
ARRAIGNMENT - 
Information filed. Copy served on defense counsel.
Not guilty pleas entered.  Jury calendar.
Settlement conference with District Attorney is set for 04-25-14 at 3:00 p.m.
Plea date is set for 05-19-14 at 10:30 a.m.
Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing.
Minutes.

Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing is set for 03-18-14 at 1:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $1,500.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that defendant must report to the Manitowoc County Sheriff's Department for fingerprints, photographs and identifying information within 24 hours and defendant is to have no contact with Marcella Becker or her residence.  Bail furnished.   
Minutes.

RE:  Marcella Becker, on 12-09-13.
Initial appearance is set for 03-03-14 at 2:30 p.m.
